decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive human creatures quickly and efficiently by using Aether Vial to cheat them into play. The deck utilizes tribal synergies with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter provide disruption while Mantis Rider and Restoration Angel offer flying beaters to close out the game. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly assemble a board of aggressive creatures that can apply pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage. The deck aims to control the battlefield through tempo plays and efficient creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Drogskol Captain. With the help of Noble Hierarch and Collected Company, the deck can quickly build a threatening board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive human tribal strategy. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to quickly boost the power of your creatures, combined with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt your opponent's game plan, you aim to quickly close out the game through combat damage. Cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch help you to cast your creatures quickly and efficiently, while Thalia, Guardian of Thraben slows down your opponent's spells, giving you the upper hand in the race to victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of artifact creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It utilizes efficient artifact mana sources like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to power out threats like Signal Pest and Vault Skirge. Key cards like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager provide additional damage and versatility in combat. The inclusion of Etched Champion and Steel Overseer provide resilience and additional boosts to the board. With a mix of flying and infect creatures, the deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

Utilize low-cost instants and sorceries to generate mana and draw cards in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. Use Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells, increasing the efficiency of the combo. Search for key cards with Gifts Ungiven and generate storm count to deal lethal damage with Grapeshot. Use Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and continue the combo. Be wary of disruption and play carefully to assemble the combo and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this aggro Humans deck is to quickly flood the board with efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The deck also takes advantage of tribal synergies with cards like Noble Hierarch and Unclaimed Territory, allowing for explosive starts and overwhelming pressure on the opponent. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and a solid mana base with Cavern of Souls, the deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy a board full of artifact creatures and utilize cards like Mox Opal, Springleaf Drum, and Galvanic Blast to power them up and deal damage to the opponent. Cranial Plating is a key card that can significantly boost the power of your creatures, while cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager provide additional ways to increase the threat level of your board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive assault using the synergy of artifacts and creatures in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing Aether Vial and efficient mana sources to quickly build a board presence of aggressive Human creatures. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and other disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage are used to slow down the opponent, while cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish can quickly grow in power with each new Human that enters the battlefield. With a mix of disruption and powerful creature synergies, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to recover.

The deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by casting efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of damage, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt to chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to apply early pressure and maintain a fast tempo. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide additional reach and versatility in dealing with opposing threats.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Sakura-Tribe Scout to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing lands that provide multiple mana sources and utilizing the Titan's ability to fetch lands, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and powerful board presence. Additionally, cards like Ancient Stirrings help to find the key pieces needed for the combo to go off smoothly. The deck also includes some interaction and protection spells to ensure the combo can be executed successfully.

This deck aims to win as quickly as possible by dealing direct damage to the opponent using burn spells and efficient creatures. It focuses on aggressive plays and maximizing damage output each turn. The deck includes a mix of low-cost burn spells, efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with powerful enchantments like Eidolon of the Great Revel. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. With a focus on speed and direct damage, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage to efficiently cast a powerful storm spell like Grapeshot. This is achieved through cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, as well as spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for combo pieces, while card filtering with Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions helps find key cards. The goal is to chain together spells to generate a high storm count and overwhelm the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot or other win condition.

This deck focuses on utilizing a synergy between the Human creature type and various powerful abilities to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to grow and buff the team, along with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's plays, this deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive pace while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creature aggression and disruption, this deck is designed to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tireless Tracker along with disruptive cards such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to apply early pressure on opponents. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to control the board while steadily building up card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Eternal Witness. Additionally, cards like Thrun, the Last Troll and Liliana of the Veil provide resilience and disruption to help secure the victory.

This deck focuses on filling up the graveyard quickly to enable the casting of powerful creatures for cheap or free, such as Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix. The deck includes cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry to help with card draw and discarding, as well as Street Wraith and Bloodghast to further capitalize on graveyard synergy. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures while utilizing the graveyard as a resource for maximum efficiency.

The deck focuses on leveraging the synergy between creatures with powerful enters-the-battlefield effects and mana dorks to accelerate the board state and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The key strategy involves using cards like Collected Company to quickly deploy threats like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a board presence with creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Voice of Resurgence. The deck also includes some utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Gavony Township to further enhance its versatility and resilience in combat.
